com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing

Interface Checkpoint

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckpointAbstract, CheckpointDefault

    public interface Checkpoint
extends Entity
    A checkpoint holds the running state of a VirtualMachine as it is at a given moment of the simulation. The checkpoint can then be used at any other moment of the simulation to restore the state of the virtual machine.

    A checkpoint is defined by its parent virtual machine and a destination host.
    The parent virtual machine is the virtual machine that is used when updating the checkpoint.
    The destination host is the host where the checkpoint information is saved.
    If you change any of them, make sure the checkpoint is not being used or you will get an exception.

    Three main methods are offered by this interface. The update(), recover(Host, VirtualMachine), and transfer(Host).
    Have a look at their respective documentation for more information.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

      • clone

        Checkpoint clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

      • getDestinationHost

        Host getDestinationHost()
        Returns the destination host that contains all the data of the checkpoint (disk files among other things).
        Returns:
        the destination host

      • setDestinationHost

        void setDestinationHost(Host destinationHost)
        Updates the destination host of the checkpoint and discards all the checkpoint information.

        The destination host contains the checkpoint and particularly any files that are used to store the checkpoint.

        Changing the destination host will delete all checkpoint files, and the checkpoint is useless until you call update().
        If you want to keep checkpoint state while changing the destination host, then use the transfer(Host) method.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the Checkpoint is busy (see getBusyState())

      • getCheckpointTime

        long getCheckpointTime()
        Returns the simulation time when this checkpoint was taken or a negative value if the checkpoint has never been updated.
        Returns:
        the simulation time when this checkpoint was taken or a negative value if the checkpoint has never been updated

      • getCheckpointEpoch

        int getCheckpointEpoch()
        Returns the epoch value related to the checkpoint.

        The epoch value is returned by VirtualMachine.getNotificationsBufferEpoch() when the checkpoint was taken.

        Returns:
        the epoch value related to the checkpoint

      • getCheckpointSize

        long getCheckpointSize()
        Returns the checkpoint size occupied on the destination host.
        Returns:
        the checkpoint size

      • getBusyState

        Checkpoint.CheckpointBusyState getBusyState()
        Returns true if the checkpoint is busy.

        The checkpoint is busy if it is performing one of these operations:

        • Updating: see update();
        • Recovering: see recover(Host, VirtualMachine);
        • Transferring: see transfer(Host).

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_BUSY_STATE_CHANGED notification is thrown when the busy flag of the checkpoint changes.

        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint is busy

      • update

        void update()
        This method updates the checkpoint accordingly to the state of its parent VirtualMachine at the current simulation time.

        The parent virtual machine may be paused at some moment of the update, and is resumed after that.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_SUCCESS is thrown when the checkpoint is updated and acknowledged successfully.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_UPDATE_ERROR notification is thrown if the checkpoint cannot be updated for any reason.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if canUpdate() returns false.

      • canUpdate

        boolean canUpdate()
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be updated.

        Common reasons to return false is if the checkpoint has no defined parent VirtualMachine or has no defined destination host (see setDestinationHost(Host)).

        This method will also return false if the checkpoint is busy (see getBusyState()).

        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be updated

      • recover

        void recover(Host recoveryHost,
           VirtualMachine vmToReplace)
        Recovers the VM state using the checkpoint data.
        A new VM is created and is placed on the given recoveryHost.
        The new VM is not started.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_SUCCESS notification is thrown when the recovery process ends successfully.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_RECOVER_ERROR notification is thrown if an error happens.

        Parameters:
        recoveryHost - the host where the recovered virtual machine will be placed
        vmToReplace - the virtual machine to replace during recovery. May be null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if canRecover(Host, VirtualMachine) returns false

      • canRecover

        boolean canRecover(Host recoveryHost,
                 VirtualMachine vmToReplace)
        Returns true if the recovery process can be engaged on the recoveryHost

        This method returns false for instance if there is no saved state to restore.

        This method also returns false if the checkpoint is busy (see getBusyState()).

        Parameters:
        recoveryHost -
        Returns:
        true if the recovery process can be engaged on the recoveryHost

      • transfer

        void transfer(Host destinationHost)
        Updates the checkpoint's destination host and keeps the checkpoint information.

        This method returns immediately, you need to listen to appropriate notification codes to know when the checkpoint have been transfered.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_TRANSFER_SUCCESS notification is thrown when the checkpoint have completely been transfered.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINT_TRANSFER_ERROR notification is thrown if there is an error during transfer.

        Parameters:
        destinationHost -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if canTransfer(Host) returns false

      • canTransfer

        boolean canTransfer(Host destinationHost)
        Returns true if the checkpoint can be transfered to the destinationHost.

        This method returns false, for instance, if the checkpoint is busy (see getBusyState()).

        Parameters:
        destinationHost -
        Returns:
        true if the checkpoint can be transfered to the destinationHost
